Posts.Content: Thank you Karri xxxx
Posts.Title: Today's the day

Posts.Content: I got a call yesterday from my consultants secretary saying to go today for my biopsy results.  To say I'm frightened is an understatement.  My brother has just rang to say hello drive us.  I'm so pleased, I could have driven there myself,  but not sure I'll be in a fit state to drive back!
Posts.Title: Today's the day

Posts.Content: I had my lumpectomy and two sentinel nodes taken on Nov 6th. One of the nodes showed a small amount of cancer which they will hit with radiotherapy. I'm having more surgery next Friday as they only got a 1mm clear margin. After that I'll have radiotherapy to breast and underarm. I was also put on Letrozole for 5 years. My tumour was measured at 18mm but was found to be 20mm. Hope all goes well x
Posts.Title: Further surgery for 'wider margins' and more lymph nodes to be re

Posts.Content: Chase it up, I went with a lump and had my app for the next week before I left the surgery. Your GP should have the choose to book system if your in England. If you are, your app should have been made immediately. Bug them, it's your body!
Posts.Title: mammogram ..??

Posts.Content: Hi Jill, could find your message link so sent a friend request. I'm already on cancer buddies UK, so not sure if it is the same group x
Posts.Title: Support group on Facebook

Posts.Content: I haven't been on here for awhile.  I had lumpectomy on Nov 6th last year and another Dec 6th as they didn't get enough clear margin the first time.  Had 3 weeks radiotherapy ended Feb 20th.  I've complained nearly 4 months that my breast was very painful red, hot & swollen.  At lastsomebody listened, had an ultrasound  last Wednesday and saw the breast nurse Friday.  I've been given 3 weeks antibiotics for an infection.  It's early days, but I'm concerned something else ideas going on.
Posts.Title: Hot & red breast

Posts.Content: I'm so happy for you, that is great news. I'm having a lumpectomy on the 23rd, won't know about my sentinel nodes until then.
Posts.Title: There is light at the end of the tunnel

Posts.Content: Well it's better news than I thought. I've a grade 2 non aggressive tumor, which means it's small and he's hoping I can have alumpectomy. But I'll have an mri to make sure there isn't any residual small little bits. If there is I'll have a mastectomy, but that's the worst case scenario. I'll probably have radiotherapy and tablets. I'm well chuffed if you can be chuffed having cancer ♥♥♥♥
Posts.Title: Got my biopsy results

Posts.Content: It's pencilled in for Oct 23rd  xx
Posts.Title: Got my biopsy results

Posts.Content: I've felt exhausted today and I haven't even had my surgery or started treatment yet, also my feet don't feel cold, but are freezing to the touch. Any advice please?
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: Hi, Alaval100, my MRI is on Wednesday morning at 8.15 which is nice and early but I've had to book a taxi into Newcastle at 7 as the traffic week be horrendous. I've had my gallbladder out too, about 7 years ago. Your doctor should be able to get you counselling, but I would have thought you would be offered it through your Breast nurse. Mind you I had my brain haemorrhage in Nov 2009 and it took over 2 years to get one. Keep asking though, as i found mine brilliant. Didn't you get physio in hospital. I've an appointment with them before I go into the ward. I'm always here if you need to chat. Where abouts are you? xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: I've just looked at the Headstrong website and it is also at The Freeman Hospital the same as the Maggie Centre. It's a pain to get too if I don't want to drive, two buses. If my local hospital had a one stop cancer shop and I can get all my treatment there apart from radiotherapy why don't they have something there. My nurse even mention two other places that do support but they don't cover my region. One is a 40 minute drive away and the other is in Berwick on the border with Scotland. It seems Northumberland Health Trust need a shake up.
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: I wish my Mam was still here,  she'd be my rock.  Have fun homework v shopping
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: Patricia that's terrible. Why has your Mam not seem you for a week, there again I only see my daughter when I'm babysitting and she drops the kids off or picks them up. She never comes for a coffee, she does ask me rarely if I want to go there for one.
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: Well I've just spoken to the breast nurse and was told is be given information of support groups (we have one that meets once a month for an hour) and the Maggie Centre. She said I could ring the Maggie Centre myself if I wanted. Not exactly the answers I wanted, so no further forward!
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: Steve had just said can I start a support group hahaha! I said it's not that easy, you need money and professional's to do that. Great idea about the survey Alaval100. I'll look at other sites to see if I can get other support.
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: I'm going to ring my nurse tomorrow. I've made a lovely friend on here who is at the same stage as me and she's had them ringing her checking she's ok and even sent her to her local Maggie Centre. I'm getting the same feeling of desertion as I did after my brain haemorrhage, no support. I've only spoken to one of the breast nurses when I've rang them to ask questions like, so I get my flu jab, can I colour my hair, I've got my new mri date. Alaval100 where are you at and do you get support. Hubby is fine, he was rushed into hospital last Sunday, he was there until Monday night. He's got gallstones and has to have an mri. We were supposed to be away for a few days, but had to cancel.
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: Patricia, I told them about you and your support and they said every region works in different ways. She said I'll be given info after my op, what about before. We haven't all got family who are supportive xx
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: sianikb I don't think my breast nurse will give me any contacts until we know my plan for surgery and treatment. She said as much this morning, now I feel like a nuisance, I won't ring them again!
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: Good morning Patricia, I'm sorry you had a bad night. We had Isla staying and she slept with Nana :-) I skeet okay but had pain in my upper arm, it felt like I had a lump in the middle of my back ugggggh! I wish my nurses were as supportive. I'm definitely going to ring and tell them I don't feel I'm getting the support. Got to ring, Isla at the toilet LOL!
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: Good morning Patricia, I'm sorry you had a bad night. We had Isla staying and she slept with Nana :-) I skeet okay but had pain in my upper arm, it felt like I had a lump in the middle of my back ugggggh! I wish my nurses were as supportive. I'm definitely going to ring and tell them I don't feel I'm getting the support.
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: I still don't know what's happening with me yet. I've an 18mm invasive, non aggressive , lobular grade 2 cancer with the possibility of having some in my sentinal nodes. I've got my MRI next Wednesday. So of course won't know what treatment or surgery in getting yet, although my surgeon is going to just do a lumpectomy.
Posts.Title: Staying to get anxious

Posts.Content: Thank Evei, Patricia I'll be thinking about you tomorrow. I and everyone on here knows how you feel. I'm scared too xx
Posts.Title: Staying to get anxious

Posts.Content: I don't know yet Emma, I hope not. I've got an echo scan on the 31st.
Posts.Title: Staying to get anxious

Posts.Content: Goodnight Patricia, sleep well x
Posts.Title: Staying to get anxious

Posts.Content: Thank you Emma Purl, I've calmed down a bit today. I've done the bad language thing to myself lol. I know I just have to go with the flow, I'm not the only one going through this, I can't change anything. We are going away tomorrow for 3 days and I thought maybe if I cancelled I might have got my MRI this Wednesday and everything could have gone ahead as planned. But no we are going and I'll enjoy it, it'll give me the chance to forget about it for a while.
Posts.Title: Staying to get anxious

Posts.Content: Hi Emma Purl, we didn't get away. Steve (hubby) took ill on Sunday teatime, he was in hospital until 6pm Monday. They've discoverd he has gallstones. He's having an MRI on the 29th then he'll discuss surgery with a consultant. I also got my new surgery date, Nov 6th. That seems ages away!
Posts.Title: Staying to get anxious

Posts.Content: LOL!!!!! misteymoley we just nipped to the local shop for some milk and bumped into a neighbour (another man) so there he goes off on one. I've got gallstones and will have to have an operation. And I'm standing there wanting to say errrrrrrrr Hello hahaha!!!!! This neighbourb doesn't know about me.
Posts.Title: Staying to get anxious

Posts.Content: Well, went Fir my pre op assessment and I've to have an echo scan as they've found a heart murmur. Jeez, anything else!
Posts.Title: Staying to get anxious

Posts.Content: I was supposed to have my mri on Thursday, but wasn't able to get it. They said they'd arrange another app at another hospital as the scanner is bigger (no it wasn't because I'm huge). Anyway my surgery was scheduled for Oct 23rd, I've got my pre op assessment on the 17th, supposed to be admitted on the 22nd but got my new appb for MRI 8.15am on the morning of my surgery. Looks like my surgery will be put back. After things happening really swiftly since my visit to the doc on Sept 12th I feel I've hit a brick wall! I just want to scream, but I know that won't do me any good. I've been relatively calm since I found out but now I'm getting feelings of dread. Is this normal?
Posts.Title: Staying to get anxious

Posts.Content: Hi Patricia, I'm newly diagnosed too. Went to my doc on Sept 12th with a lump, had a mammogram, scan and biopsies in the 19th. I was told straight away I had cancer. I should have had my MRI last Thursday but the scanner at my lovely hospital is tiny and my back was scraping along the top of the scanner. My surgery was planned for the 23rd Oct but had been cancelled until Nov 6th because I need to go to Newcastle for my MRI now. It's natural to be scared, I was terrified when they told me. The waiting between appointments has been the worst. I just want my surgery and treatment to get started. I've been very positive, of course I've had an occasional lapse, but I feel stronger for being so positive. If you're normally strong try and stay strong. I gave myself a good taking too the night I found out and said, there's nothing you can do about it, it's not a cold, it won't disappear overnight. What I did do was a bit of retail therapy, that cheered me up. I'm not sure whether I've helped, I know you'll get through it, as we all will.
Posts.Title: coping with diagnosis
